| Overview                = The '''Celestial Order of the Hai-Dai''' is a group of assassins, and one of many criminal organizations dedicated to serve [[Zheng Zu (Earth-616)|Zheng Zu (also known as Fu Manchu)]].
| History                 = 
===Early years===
The '''Celestial Order of the Hai-Dai''' was a criminal organization of ninjas,{{r|Fearless Defenders #8}} and of many groups living to serve only [[Zheng Zu (Earth-616)|Zheng Zu]].<!-- {{r|Secret Avengers #6}} -->

Like other of those organizations, the Hai-Dai disbanded after their master's death, purposeless.{{r|Secret Avengers #6}}

===Recent years<!-- subjective -->===
Years later, upon Zheng Zu's partial resurrection by [[Shadow Council (Earth-616)|Shadow Council]] director [[Aloysius Thorndrake (Earth-616)|Director Aloysius Thorndrake]], they reformed, and attacked underground temples in [[Shanghai]], looking for a scroll about the [[Eyes of the Dragon]], two gems working in tandem, said to date back at least 3000 years, to be imbued with great spiritual energy bringing extraordinary luck to their owner, and (due to its creators pouring the last of their essence into them before death) to complete a resurrection spell, necessary for completing Zheng Zu's resurrection. They also targeted Zheng Zu's son [[Shang-Chi (Earth-616)|Shang-Chi]], another ingredient for that.<!-- {{r|Secret Avengers #6}} -->

They next set up a trap at an exhibit of ancient Chinese art in the [[International Finance Centre]] in [[Hong Kong]] where [[Secret Avengers (Black Ops Unit) (Earth-616)|Secret Avengers]], including Shang-Chi, went, believing one of the gems was there.{{r|Secret Avengers #6}} The Hai-Dai captured Shang-Chi and brought him onto their plane to execute him, but [[Eric O'Grady (Earth-616)|Ant-Man]], hidden in Shang-Chi's hair, caused the plane to crash.{{r|Secret Avengers #7}}

They soon led an attack in broad daylight in downtown Hong Kong, led by Zheng Zu, as part of a trick. As the Secret Avengers intervened, Shadow Council agents [[Max Fury (Earth-616)|Max Fury]] and [[John Steele (American Soldier) (Earth-616)|John Steele]] to capture [[Sharon Carter (Earth-616)|Sharon Carter]], to exchange her for Shang-Chi. As soon as she was captive, the Hai-Dai and Zheng Zu vanished.{{r|Secret Avengers #8}}

Shang-Chi was finally captured, and brought to the [[Sacred Temple of Zheng-Zu]], in [[China]], where Black Council and Hai-Dai guarded over him before the ritual's completion. The Secret Avengers intervened in the course of the ritual, stopping it. The Hai-Dai weren't seen during the ensuing battle, in which Zheng Zu was killed.{{r|Secret Avengers #10}}

Shang-Chi trained [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Spider-Man]] at an abandoned Hai-Dai training facility in [[Croton-on-Hudson]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man #664}}

Later, led by Zheng Zu's daughter [[Zheng Bao Yu (Earth-616)|Zheng Bao Yu]], they set up a lab under [[Chinatown (New York)|Chinatown]], in [[New York City]], where they continued a long-forgotten experiment of Zheng Zu by bio-engineering [[Brood (Race)|Brood]] (or rather "genetic mutations spawned from tainted Brood DNA"), which they used for assassinations, until the [[Defenders (Valkyrior) (Earth-616)|Defenders]] Valkyrie and [[Mercedes Knight (Earth-616)|Misty Knight]] recruited [[Elsa Bloodstone (Earth-616)|Elsa Bloodstone]] in their inquiry about monsters in Chinatown, and tracked down the lab. During the fight against the Brood, Hai Dai, and Zheng Bao Yu, the Defenders were joined by [[No-Name (Earth-616)|No-Name of Brood]].{{r|Fearless Defenders #8}}

It was later revealed by [[Zheng Shi-Hua (Earth-616)|Shi-Hua]] that the Si-Fan, along with the [[Celestial Order of the Si-Fan (Earth-616)|Order of the Si-Fan]] and the [[Order of the Golden Dawn (Earth-616)|Order of the Golden Dawn]], were aliases used for the [[Five Weapons Society (Earth-616)|Five Weapons Society]], much like how Fu Manchu was an alias for Zheng Zu.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 1 2}}
